pages.title: Laser Quarry
pages.text: The Laser Quarries are utility blocks. By using a properly set Laser Focus, the Quarry can seemingly create resources out of thin air. In reality it's more complicated than that: the laser fired by the quarry can phase through the bedrock and the void until it reaches an ore allowed by the focus, destroying it at a subatomic level and sending it back to the quarry, where its recombined in a physical form.

There are three tiers of Laser Quarries: Basic, Advanced and Ultimate. The only difference between them is the speed of the operation. No point in keeping the basic version unless you are hurt on resources.
You may have seen that the previous recipes required some components. Here's how to craft them.

The Laser Quarries run on special purposed fuel. They are the Fuel Cells. For every successful operation the Fuel Cell will deplete a bit of its durability. Higher tiers of Fuel Cell have better durability.
When a Fuel Cell reaches 0 durability inside a Laser Quarry, the machine will halt its operations and spit out an empty fuel cell. It then can be collected and crafted again into a new Fuel Cell.
The Laser Quarries requires a properly set Laser Focus. They come in three tiers, Basic, Advanced and Ultimate, each of them representing the complexity of the lens required to attune the laser.

pages.title: Setting a Focus
pages.text: To set a Laser Focus, craft it with a raw metal (or the resource itself if not a metal). Simple and abundant Overworld materials like Coal, Iron and Gold must use a Basic Focus. Rarer materials usually require an Advanced Focus. Extremely rare or complex materials must be set with an Ultimate Focus. You can craft a set Laser Focus by itself and obtain and unset Focus (but you will lose the resource used beforehand).
